The main psychostimulants used therapeutically in France are non-amphetamine psychostimulants. Methylphenidate and modafinil are the two substances in this class to be aware of.

question.title: What are the two main psychostimulants used therapeutically in France?
question.description: The main psychostimulants used therapeutically in France are non-amphetamine psychostimulants. Methylphenidate and modafinil are the two substances in this class to be aware of.

option_a.title: Methylphenidate
option_a.description: A non-amphetamine psychostimulant commonly used to treat attention deficit hyperactivity disorder (ADHD).

option_b.title: Modafinil
option_b.description: A non-amphetamine psychostimulant used to treat narcolepsy, shift work sleep disorder, and excessive daytime sleepiness.

option_c.title: Amphetamine
option_c.description: A highly potent psychostimulant that can be used to treat ADHD, but is not typically used in France due to its potential for abuse.

option_d.title: Ritalin
option_d.description: A non-amphetamine psychostimulant used to treat ADHD, but is not typically used in France due to its potential for abuse.

correct_option.title: Methylphenidate
correct_option.description: A non-amphetamine psychostimulant commonly used to treat attention deficit hyperactivity disorder (ADHD).
